CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 36 OPVs based on blends of benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene copolymers and PC61BM exhibited PCEs as high as 2.17% . 37-40 In this paper , we report creation of a new fused - ring building block dithieno[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 -h]phthalimide ( 8 , Figure 2 ) and its application in design and synthesis of conjugated polymers. The combination of benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene planarity and efficient π-π stacking with the electron - withdrawing capacity of the imide functionality serves as the foundation for this new class of materials. Introduction of the π-electron - deficient imide moiety can decrease the HOMO and LUMO energies of the polymers , which is necessary for air - stable polymers. Furthermore , substitution at the imide nitrogen allows introduction of functionalities and solubility improvement with varying degrees of steric bulk while not impinging on critical intermolecular π-π stacking characteristics. This motif also leaves the benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene 2-and 7-positions available for polymerization. Finally , the dipole moment caused by the imide could stabilize cofacial antiparallel intra-and interchain repeat unit orientations , planarize the backbone , and promote π-π stacking. 27 On the basis of this new building block , we designed and synthesized a series of conjugated copolymers : unit 8 coupled with electron - rich unit benzo[1,2b:4,5-b 0 ]dithiophene ( P1 and P2 ) or with electron - deficient unit 2,2 0 -bithiazole ( P3 and P4 ) or benzo [c] [1,2,5]thiadiazole ( P5 ) and homopolymer ( P6 ) ( Figure 2 ). The optical properties and electronic structure ( HOMO / LUMO levels and bandgap ) can be manipulated through adjusting copolymerized building blocks. ' RESULTS AND DISCUSSION Synthesis and Characterization. The synthetic routes to the monomers and polymers are outlined in Schemes 1 and 2. We chose very cheap , industrial product maleic anhydride as a starting material. Bromination of maleic anhydride with Br 2 gave its dibromide ( 1 ). 41 Then , amination with alkylamine afforded the alkyl-substituted 3,4dibromopyrrole-2,5-dione ( 2a,b ). Suzuki coupling reaction of the dibromide 2a,b with 3-thienylboronic acid gave 3,4-bis(3-thienyl)pyrrole-2,5-dione ( 3a,b ). The large sulfur - containing polycyclic aromatic imides , dithieno[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 -h]phthalimide ( 4a,b ) , were synthesized through iron(III) chloride - mediated oxidative cyclization , which is a general strategy for ring closure. 42 Bromination of 4a , b with Br 2 gave rise to the monomers 5a,b. Stille coupling reaction of 5a with tributyl(thiophen-2-yl)stannane afforded 2,7-bis(2-thienyl)-dithieno[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 -h]phthalimide ( 6a ) , which was brominated with NBS to afford monomer 7a. Copolymers P1-P4 were synthesized through Stille coupling reaction of the dibromide monomers 5a,b or 7a with benzodithiophene-2,6-ditin or 2,2 0 -bithiazole-5,5 0 -ditin , while P5 was synthesized through Suzuki coupling reaction of the dibromide monomer 5b with benzothiadiazole-4,7-diboronic ester. Homopolymer P6 was synthesized by palladium - catalyzed homocoupling of the dibromide 5b in the presence of hexabutylditin. P1 with three solubilizing n-dodecyl groups has good solubility in common organic solvents such as chloroform , THF , and toluene.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. Benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene: This is a type of conjugated polymer.
2. PC61BM: This is another type of conjugated polymer.
3. dithieno[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 -h]phthalimide: This is a new building block used in the synthesis of conjugated polymers.
4. 2,7-bis(2-thienyl)-dithieno[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 -h]phthalimide: This is a specific conjugated polymer synthesized through Stille coupling reaction of the dibromide monomer 5a with tributyl(thiophen-2-yl)stannane.
5. benzodithiophene-2,6-ditin: This is a monomer used in the synthesis of conjugated polymers.
6. 2,2 0 -bithiazole-5,5 0 -ditin: This is another monomer used in the synthesis of conjugated polymers.
7. benzothiadiazole-4,7-diboronic ester: This is a monomer used in the synthesis of conjugated polymers.
8. benzodithiophene: This is a type of conjugated polymer.

These are the "Material Name" entities mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the relevant "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. Benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene
2. dithieno[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 -h]phthalimide

These are the only two entities in the paragraph that refer directly to "Material Name".

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid "Material Name" entities from the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene |
| dithieno[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 -h]phthalimide |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 36 OPVs based on blends of benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene copolymers and PC61BM exhibited PCEs as high as 2.17% . 37-40 In this paper , we report creation of a new fused - ring building block dithieno[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 -h]phthalimide ( 8 , Figure 2 ) and its application in design and synthesis of conjugated polymers. The combination of benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene planarity and efficient π-π stacking with the electron - withdrawing capacity of the imide functionality serves as the foundation for this new class of materials. Introduction of the π-electron - deficient imide moiety can decrease the HOMO and LUMO energies of the polymers , which is necessary for air - stable polymers. Furthermore , substitution at the imide nitrogen allows introduction of functionalities and solubility improvement with varying degrees of steric bulk while not impinging on critical intermolecular π-π stacking characteristics. This motif also leaves the benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene 2-and 7-positions available for polymerization. Finally , the dipole moment caused by the imide could stabilize cofacial antiparallel intra-and interchain repeat unit orientations , planarize the backbone , and promote π-π stacking. 27 On the basis of this new building block , we designed and synthesized a series of conjugated copolymers : unit 8 coupled with electron - rich unit benzo[1,2b:4,5-b 0 ]dithiophene ( P1 and P2 ) or with electron - deficient unit 2,2 0 -bithiazole ( P3 and P4 ) or benzo [c] [1,2,5]thiadiazole ( P5 ) and homopolymer ( P6 ) ( Figure 2 ). The optical properties and electronic structure ( HOMO / LUMO levels and bandgap ) can be manipulated through adjusting copolymerized building blocks. ' RESULTS AND DISCUSSION Synthesis and Characterization. The synthetic routes to the monomers and polymers are outlined in Schemes 1 and 2. We chose very cheap , industrial product maleic anhydride as a starting material. Bromination of maleic anhydride with Br 2 gave its dibromide ( 1 ). 41 Then , amination with alkylamine afforded the alkyl-substituted 3,4dibromopyrrole-2,5-dione ( 2a,b ). Suzuki coupling reaction of the dibromide 2a,b with 3-thienylboronic acid gave 3,4-bis(3-thienyl)pyrrole-2,5-dione ( 3a,b ). The large sulfur - containing polycyclic aromatic imides , dithieno[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 -h]phthalimide ( 4a,b ) , were synthesized through iron(III) chloride - mediated oxidative cyclization , which is a general strategy for ring closure. 42 Bromination of 4a , b with Br 2 gave rise to the monomers 5a,b. Stille coupling reaction of 5a with tributyl(thiophen-2-yl)stannane afforded 2,7-bis(2-thienyl)-dithieno[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 -h]phthalimide ( 6a ) , which was brominated with NBS to afford monomer 7a. Copolymers P1-P4 were synthesized through Stille coupling reaction of the dibromide monomers 5a,b or 7a with benzodithiophene-2,6-ditin or 2,2 0 -bithiazole-5,5 0 -ditin , while P5 was synthesized through Suzuki coupling reaction of the dibromide monomer 5b with benzothiadiazole-4,7-diboronic ester. Homopolymer P6 was synthesized by palladium - catalyzed homocoupling of the dibromide 5b in the presence of hexabutylditin. P1 with three solubilizing n-dodecyl groups has good solubility in common organic solvents such as chloroform , THF , and toluene.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the property names of the materials mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene
2. PC61BM
3. Dithieno[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 -h]phthalimide
4. Benzodithiophene-2,6-ditin
5. 2,2 0 -bithiazole-5,5 0 -ditin
6. Benzothiadiazole-4,7-diboronic ester
7. Hexabutylditin
8. Maleic anhydride
9. Br 2 (bromine)
10. Alkylamine
11. 3-Thienylboronic acid
12. Tributyl(thiophen-2-yl)stannane
13. NBS (N-bromosuccinimide)

Note that some of these materials have multiple names or synonyms, but I have listed them consistently throughout the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Of course! Here are the property names of materials mentioned in the paragraph after removing irrelevant entities:

1. Benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene
2. Dithieno[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 -h]phthalimide
3. Benzodithiophene-2,6-ditin
4. 2,2 0 -bithiazole-5,5 0 -ditin
5. Benzothiadiazole-4,7-diboronic ester

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 36 OPVs based on blends of benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene copolymers and PC61BM exhibited PCEs as high as 2.17% . 37-40 In this paper , we report creation of a new fused - ring building block dithieno[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 -h]phthalimide ( 8 , Figure 2 ) and its application in design and synthesis of conjugated polymers. Furthermore , substitution at the imide nitrogen allows introduction of functionalities and solubility improvement with varying degrees of steric bulk while not impinging on critical intermolecular π-π stacking characteristics. This motif also leaves the benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b 0 ]dithiophene 2-and 7-positions available for polymerization. Finally , the dipole moment caused by the imide could stabilize cofacial antiparallel intra-and interchain repeat unit orientations , planarize the backbone , and promote π-π stacking. 27 On the basis of this new building block , we designed and synthesized a series of conjugated copolymers : unit 8 coupled with electron - rich unit benzo[1,2b:4,5-b 0 ]dithiophene ( P1 and P2 ) or with electron - deficient unit 2,2 0 -bithiazole ( P3 and P4 ) or benzo [c] [1,2,5]thiadiazole ( P5 ) and homopolymer ( P6 ) ( Figure 2 ). The optical properties and electronic structure ( HOMO / LUMO levels and bandgap ) can be manipulated through adjusting copolymerized building blocks. ' RESULTS AND DISCUSSION Synthesis and Characterization. The synthetic routes to the monomers and polymers are outlined in Schemes 1 and 2. We chose very cheap , industrial product maleic anhydride as a starting material. Bromination of maleic anhydride with Br 2 gave its dibromide ( 1 ). 41 Then , amination with alkylamine afforded the alkyl-substituted 3,4dibromopyrrole-2,5-dione ( 2a,b ). Suzuki coupling reaction of the dibromide 2a,b with 3-thienylboronic acid gave 3,4-bis(3-thienyl)pyrrole-2,5-dione ( 3a,b ). The large sulfur - containing polycyclic aromatic imides , dithieno[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 -h]phthalimide ( 4a,b ) , were synthesized through iron(III) chloride - mediated oxidative cyclization , which is a general strategy for ring closure. 42 Bromination of 4a , b with Br 2 gave rise to the monomers 5a,b. Homopolymer P6 was synthesized by palladium - catalyzed homocoupling of the dibromide 5b in the presence of hexabutylditin. P1 with three solubilizing n-dodecyl groups has good solubility in common organic solvents such as chloroform , THF , and toluene.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the values of material properties in the paragraph:

1. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) energy: Not mentioned directly, but can be inferred from the statement that introducing the π-electron-deficient imide moiety can decrease the HOMO and LUMO energies of the polymers.
2. LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) energy: Not mentioned directly, but can be inferred from the statement that introducing the π-electron-deficient imide moiety can decrease the HOMO and LUMO energies of the polymers.
3. Bandgap (energy difference between HOMO and LUMO): Not mentioned directly, but can be inferred from the statement that the HOMO and LUMO energies of the polymers can be manipulated through adjusting copolymerized building blocks.
4. Dipole moment: Mentioned in the paragraph as a result of the imide functionality, which can stabilize cofacial antiparallel intra- and interchain repeat unit orientations, planarize the backbone, and promote π-π stacking.
5. Steric bulk: Mentioned in the paragraph as a result of substitution at the imide nitrogen, which allows introduction of functionalities and solubility improvement while not impinging on critical intermolecular π-π stacking characteristics.
6. Solubility: Mentioned in the paragraph as a value for the copolymer P1, which has good solubility in common organic solvents such as chloroform, THF, and toluene.
7. Maleic anhydride: Mentioned as a starting material in the synthesis of the monomers and polymers. Its molecular weight is not mentioned in the paragraph.
8. Br2 (bromine): Mentioned as a reagent in the synthesis of the monomers and polymers. Its molecular weight is not mentioned in the paragraph.
9. Alkylamine: Mentioned as a reagent in the synthesis of the monomers and polymers. Its molecular weight is not mentioned in the paragraph.
10. 3,4-bis(3-thienyl)pyrrole-2,5-dione: Mentioned as a monomer in the synthesis of the copolymers. Its molecular weight is not mentioned in the paragraph.
11. 2,7-bis(2-thienyl)-dithieno[3,2-f : 2^0 ,3 0 -h]phthalimide: Mentioned as a monomer in the synthesis of the copolymers. Its molecular weight is not mentioned in the paragraph.
12. Tributyl(thiophen-2-yl)stannane: Mentioned as a reagent in the synthesis of the monomers and polymers. Its molecular weight is not mentioned in the paragraph.
13. Benzodithiophene-2,6-ditin: Mentioned as a monomer in the synthesis of the copolymers. Its molecular weight is not mentioned in the paragraph.
14. 2,2 0 -bithiazole-5,5 0 -ditin: Mentioned as a monomer in the synthesis of the copolymers. Its molecular weight is not mentioned in the paragraph.
15. Palladium: Mentioned as a catalyst in the synthesis of the homopolymer. Its molecular weight is not mentioned in the paragraph.
16. Hexabutylditin: Mentioned as a solvent in the synthesis of the homopolymer. Its molecular weight is not mentioned in the paragraph.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to the value of material properties in the provided text:

1. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) energy
2. LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) energy
3. bandgap (energy difference between HOMO and LUMO)
4. dipole moment
5. steric bulk

These are the material properties that are directly related to the electronic structure of the molecule and can be used to describe its electronic behavior.
